(IM)Hola {player.name}, hay negocios de la Corporación que necesito discutir contigo. Por favor contacte conmigo en la {object.name@L2M024.ContactStation} en {object.sector.name@L2M024.ContactStation}.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
(IM)La fábrica está funcionando correctamente, aunque pasará algún tiempo antes de que empiece a generar beneficios.

(IM){3224,240401}\nAdemás, dado que hemos estabilizado nuestros plazos de entrega, uno de nuestros clientes ha aumentado sus pedidos regulares, esto nos ha proporcionado un pequeño empujón en la reputación corporativa.

(IM)El coste de crear una patrulla de cazas de combate para proteger los convoyes está dando sus frutos. Ahora las pérdidas son mínimas, nuestros clientes están satisfechos de que las entregas lleguen a tiempo y otras empresas que usan esta ruta nos están muy agradecidas.

(IM)La fábrica a la que prestamos el dinero esta ahora en marcha, parece que están haciendo un buen trabajo.\nNo sólo están cumpliendo con la devolución del préstamo puntualmente, sino que además nos han mandado algunos contactos de negocios.

(IM)Nuestra {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.MineralWare}} está en marcha, y las primeras entregas se han hecho. Parece que también hemos encontrado alguien a quien vender los excedentes.\nEsto ha dado un gran impulso a la Corporación.

(IM)Por el momento los Duke han mantenido su parte del trato, todavía estan en el nivel acordado con los pagos por protección. Lamentablemente, algunas empresas locales se enteraron del trato con los piratas y se perdieron algunos contratos.

(IM)De momento todo va bien, los Duke no han intentado aumentar los pagos por protección, ni parece que las empresas locales hayan descubierto nuestra relaciones.\nCreo que esta vez podemos habernos salido con la nuestra.

(IM)Esto es peor de lo esperado. Los Dukes están exigiendo mayores pagos por la protección, además de esto ha llegado a los oídos de varias empresas locales rumores del trato que hicimos con los piratas, y se han perdido algunos contratos.

(IM)Tal y como temíamos, los Duke exigen ahora mas dinero para la protección, espero que no se agrave demasiado la situación. El lado positivo es que no ha habido consecuencias relacionadas con esta materia de parte de las empresas locales.
(IM)Se ha detenido la producción en la fábrica. Espero que cuando la situación mejore, podamos ser capaces de ponerla de nuevo en marcha.

(IM)Los mercenarios están rindiendo como esperábamos, y nuestros convoyes salen adelante con seguridad. También hemos sido capaces de ofrecer a una pequeña empresa la oportunidad de añadir sus dos naves a nuestro convoy para ofrecerles protección.
(IM)Gracias a la protección proporcionada por los mercenarios, nuestros convoyes están cumpliendo con los plazos de entrega.

(IM)El solicitante del préstamo ha aceptado nuestra oferta del 50% de la cantidad que buscaban, y han empezado a pagar sus cuotas periódicas. También nos han enviado algunos contactos de negocios, no tantos como me hubiese gustado, pero supongo que también tienen que considerar a otros fiadores.

(IM)El solicitante del préstamo ha rechazado nuestra oferta del 50%, y se fueron a otro lugar para encontrar dinero. Por desgracia, decidió construir cerca de una de nuestras fábricas, y han logrado atraer alguno de nuestros contratos.

(IM)Los mineros móviles han estado realizando el trabajo. Hemos tenido las típicas facturas por reparaciones, pero nada importante hasta el momento, y el tiempo de entrega se ha cumplido en la mayoría de los casos.\nMi preocupación es que cuando necesiten moverse más lejos para minar {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.MineralWare}}, la distribución les puede llevar más tiempo, y con este retraso ocasional en la entrega puede que los clientes no estén satisfechos. Supongo que vigilar la situación es lo único que podemos hacer.

(IM)Parece ser que a los Duke no les gustó que los rechazaramos. Nos golpearon fuerte y duro, perdimos un convoy entero y, posteriormente, el contrato por falta de entrega.\nMenos mal que era el único convoy que teníamos operando en la zona en ese momento. Pero, está claro, que vamos a a necesitar alguna forma de protección si queremos que nuestros convoyes usen esa ruta en un futuro.

(IM)Sorprendentemente, no parece haber habido represalias por rechazar la oferta de protección de los Dukes. Por si acaso, vale la pena ver, si podemos destinar un par de cazas de escolta de los otros grupos, para dar a nuestros convoyes de esta zona un poco más de protección...

(IM)La estación ha sido vendida, lo que nos ha dado un impulso muy necesario a las finanzas y reputación de la Corporación. Por desgracia, va a ser muy difícil volver a ese mercado potencialmente lucrativo de esa zona.
(IM)Para tener en cuenta la ruta más larga he logrado cambiar los plazos de entrega con nuestros clientes. Para que no se interrumpa el suministro vamos a aumentar el volumen de cada envío.
(IM)Por desgracia, no todos los clientes estaban contentos con los plazos de entrega más largos, y como resultado han cambiado de proveedor.

(IM)El individuo que nos pedía un préstamo no estaba contento después de que lo rechazáramos.\nPor lo que se han posicionado como competencia directa de una de nuestras factorías y se las han arreglado para quitarnos varios de nuestros clientes.

(IM)Parece que ha funcionado bien la subcontratación del trabajo. La Corporación mas grande está satisfecha de que se este entregando su {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.MineralWare}} sin problemas. La compañía que estamos usando está agradecida por el negocio estable que les hemos proporcionado y nosotros conseguimos algo de dinero sin gastar un solo crédito.

(IM)Se ha cancelado la huelga, y se ha reanudado la producción en nuestra fábrica. Hasta ahora, no ha habido huelgas por efecto dominó en otras de nuestras estaciones, así que espero que este asunto este terminado.

(IM)Se ha cancelado la huelga, y se ha reanudado la producción en nuestra fábrica. Por desgracia, se ha filtrado el acuerdo de aumento a varias de nuestras fábricas, que amenazan con una acción similar. Al final resolver la situación en toda la Corporación nos va a costar {value.formatted@L2M024.StrikePay} créditos.

(IM)La plantilla de trabajadores están satisfechos con las nuevas gafas de protección, y nosotros con nuestra preocupación por su bienestar. Ha habido algunas quejas por tener que usar gafas de protección, pero se les ha dicho que la decisión de llevarlas solo depende de ellos, y que una vez proporcionada la protección adecuada la Corporación no se hará responsable de ninguna reclamación.

(IM)El negocio que rescatamos, poco a poco está logrando cambiar las cosas e incluso estan empezando a devolver el préstamo. Nos han prometido que darían prioridad a nuestro contrato como contrapartida de prestales el dinero, por lo menos nuestros clientes estan satisfechos.

(IM)No es un buen resultado. El individuo tomó el dinero del rescate (préstamo...se refiere a que le prestaron dinero para rescatar el negocio) y puso pies en polvorosa...\nNo creo que llegara muy lejos, como he escuchado que acreedores insatisfechos de al menos tres contratos han tomado medidas.\nSin embargo nos ha vaciado los bolsillos. Mientras tanto, el departamento de gestión de estaciones ha conseguido el respaldo financiero para hacerse cargo de la estación, espero que pronto no sea más que otro negocio. Tuve que ofrecer un descuento al cliente en las próximas entregas para apaciguarle, aunque no esté demasiado contento, entiende la situación y nos ha dado un poco de tiempo para retomar las entregas habituales.
(IM)Bueno, esto ha tenido muy buena acogida, la huelga se ha cancelado y ya hay un aumento de la productividad.

(IM)No les ha gustado la idea a los huelguistas. Al final conseguí que se conformaran con la cuarta parte de lo que demandaban, pero les tuve que prometer que dentro de dos meses volveríamos a revisar su salario. Al menos por ahora la fábrica está en funcionamiento de nuevo.

(IM)La formación en materia de seguridad está en marcha, algunos de los trabajadores se quejan por tener que estar un día sentados en una clase, pero tendrán que acostumbrarse. También me he enterado que algunas empresas tendrán en cuenta la política de seguridad de una compañía a la hora de decidir si hacer o no negocios con ella, así que esto debería ayudarnos.

(IM)El propietario de la estación no estaba contento de que le hayamos retirado del negocio comprando la estación, pero al final, el negocio es el negocio. Incluso podríamos lograr retener algunos de sus clientes, si somos capaces de cambiar las cosas en la estación con la suficiente rapidez.

(IM)Fue suficiente la amenaza de perder sus puestos para que los huelguistas volvieran al trabajo, pero no estan contentos. Tendremos que vigilar de cerca la fábrica, ya que no creo que esto sea el final del conflicto.

(IM)La amenaza de perder los puestos de trabajo no funcionó, así que al final acabé despidiendo a un tercio de la plantilla, como resultado, la producción se ha reducido y la moral del personal está por los suelos. Además de todo esto, ahora tenemos que contratar y formar a nuevos trabajadores, no son buenas noticias en absoluto.
(IM)Hemos pagado la imdemmización, esperemos que no tengamos muchos más de estos pequeños accidentes.
(IM)He encontrado otro proveedor, por desgracia, no vamos a tener tantos beneficios con este, pero al menos parece ser estable económicamente.

(IM)Me llevó más tiempo del esperado encontrar un nuevo proveedor. Por si fuera poco, uno de nuestros competidores se hizo cargo de la empresa en quiebra y nos ha quitado algunos de nuestros negocios.
(IM)Se ha enviado el pago de ayuda. Afortunadamente, parece que mejoran las condiciones en la superficie del planeta.

(IM)El donativo fue muy bien recibido, aunque creo que estaban un poco decepcionados por la cantidad. Les expliqué que la Corporación en estos momentos está teniendo algunos problemas financieros, y que esto era lo mejor que podíamos hacer.

(IM)Bueno, esto no les gusto nada. No pudieron entender que no podíamos enviar dinero para la ayuda en este momento, si la Corporación se declaraba en quiebra, enviar dinero a los necesitados del planeta podría ser a costa de cientos de puestos de trabajo.

(IM)Emplear los servicios de un influenciador político parece que ha dado sus frutos. Ha sido rechazado el proyecto de ley para subir los impuestos en el sector, por lo que con el tiempo vamos a recuperar el coste.

(IM)¡¡Esto es demasiado!! No se para que demonios estábamos pagando a ese influenciador político si el proyecto de ley ha sido aprobado. Así que no sólo hemos tenido que pagar por sus 'servicios', sino que ademas ahora vamos a tener que pagar un extra de {value.formatted@L2M024.TaxCost} créditos en impuestos cada semana.
(IM)La campaña de publicidad está en marcha y ya muestra beneficios. Sin duda alguna fue una gran idea.
(IM)Ya han publicado el artículo y nos deja en muy buena posición, tanto nuestra reputación como los negocios han salido beneficiados por esto.
(IM)No fue una buena idea dejar entrar al periodista en las fábricas. Se ha centrado en todos los aspectos negativos, ha afectado a los negocios y la reputación de la Corporación.

(IM)Se han solucionado los problemas de calidad en {object.name@L2M024.ProblemStation} y nuestros clientes parecen satisfechos. Además, el servicio de notícias hizo un artículo de seguimiento, destacando que somos capaces de responder de una manera rápida y correcta a los problemas planteados.
(IM)Bien, todo fue sobre ruedas, unos cuantos sobornos a los miembros de la Comisión fueron suficientes para influir en su voto, y han rechazado el proyecto de ley.

(IM)Malas noticias, me temo... Creía habérmelas arreglado para encontrar al único Teladi receptivo cuando se trata de dinero. Peor aún, decidieron que el público debía saber lo que intentábamos hacer y esto no ha sido bueno para los negocios, ademas con la ley aprobada vamos a tener que pagar más impuestos.

(IM)Nuestra pequeña campaña de publicidad muestra algunos retornos de la inversión, nada comparable con lo que haría una sólida campaña, pero siempre podemos aumentar el presupuesto cuando las finazas nos lo permitan.
(IM)Bueno, el periodista ni se molestó en escribir al final un artículo sobre nosotros, así que no hay consecuencias por negarle el acceso a nuestras fábricas.

(IM)Al periodista no le gustó que se le negara el acceso a nuestras fábricas, escribió un artículo mordaz diciendo que, obviamente, teniamos malas condiciones de trabajo y un pobre control de calidad, por lo que ha tenido un impacto en el negocio.
(IM)Ningún cliente se quejó - no afecta a los negocios.
(IM)Ha habido unos pocos clientes que se han quejado, y uno ha decidido llevar su negocio a otra parte.

(IM)No ha habido sorpresas, aprobaron el proyecto de ley. Sólo espero que hagan algo útil con el dinero extra, como aumentar la seguridad del sector, lo que sería beneficioso para nosotros y nuetros clientes.
(IM)¡¡No me lo puedo creer!! Han rechazado el proyecto de ley. Ningún gasto, y sin nuevos impuestos que pagar, una situación muy beneficiosa para nosotros.

(IM)Gracias a que nuestros clientes nos han recomendado hemos visto un leve aumento de los negocios, pero no tanto como necesitábamos. Tendremos que asegurarnos de iniciar algún tipo de campaña de publicidad tan pronto como tengamos algo de dinero extra.
(IM)Hemos ganado nuestra batalla legal y el servicio de noticias se ha visto obligado a imprimir una disculpa y pagar una indemnización.
(IM)Hemos perdido el juicio contra el servicio de noticias, que ha dañado nuestra reputación aún más, por no hablar de todos los honorarios legales.

(IM)Parece que el proceso judicial se va a convertir en un caso largo, siempre y cuando al final ganemos, vamos a recuperar nuestros costes legales, pero probablemente habría sido más barato arreglar el problema antes de empezar.

Una de nuestras estaciones en {sector.name@L2M024.RepSector} está perdiendo dinero debido a las pobres líneas de suministro, en el área también hay otra empresa produciendo las mismos productos.\nTenemos tres opciones para resolver satisfactoriamente la situación, pero no estoy seguro de cual es la mejor medida a seguir.

Una de nuestras rutas de comercio está conduciendo a nuestros cargueros a través de sectores frecuentados por Piratas. Estamos perdiendo cargamentos y en ocasiones las naves a causa de los ataques.\nPara proteger a nuestros pilotos debemos tomar una decisión.

Se me acercó un individuo buscando crear un negocio de {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.LoanWare}} y tratando de pedir prestados {value.formatted@L2M024.LoanAmount} para empezar.\n¿Qué piensas de todo esto?

Una de las Corporaciones mas grandes nos ha ofrecido un contrato para que les suministremos {value.formatted@L2M024.MineralAmount} unidades de {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.MineralWare}} cada semana.\nRechazarlo no es una opción, ya que hay demasiados beneficios en juego. Lo que tenemos que decidir es la mejor forma de satisfacer sus necesidades.

Los trabajadores de nuestra {17,{lookup.type.name.textid@{value@L2M024.StrikeStationType}}} han iniciado una huelga para exigir un aumento de salario y una reducción de jornada. Para solucionar este conflicto voy a necesitar un poco de ayuda.

Uno de nuestros trabajadores resultó herido en el ojo por la caída de limaduras de hierro en nuestra {17,{lookup.type.name.textid@{value@L2M024.StrikeStationType}}}. No tenemos otra opción que pagar su reclamación de {value.formatted@L2M024.Compensation} créditos para compensarle. Sin embargo, ¿tenemos que tomar medidas para asegurarnos que casos como este no vuelvan a suceder?

Una de nuestras subcontratas, que está al borde de la quiebra, ha venido en busca de ayuda. Por desgracia, la usábamos para abastecer uno de nuestros contratos importantes, por lo que vamos a tener que tomar medidas para remediar la situación.

Un desastre natural ha afectado uno de los planetas del sector {sector.name@L2M024.DisasterSector}. Se les ha pedido a las empresas locales ayuda y nos solicitan {value.formatted@L2M024.ReliefCost} créditos para colaborar en la operación de socorro.

Un representante de los Bucaneros de Duke ha contactado conmigo, ofreciendo protección para nuestros convoyes que circulan a través de ciertos sectores.\nHacer tratos con Piratas no sueles ser una buena idea, pero negarnos podría tener un alto coste también. Me gustaría que dieras tu opinión sobre el tema.

La Comisión de Comercio Teladi va a votar un proyecto de ley que aumentará los impuestos a varios negocios por el uso del sector. Si esta medida es aprobada, tendremos que pagar muchos más impuestos que antes.\nSin embargo, un influenciador político ha ofrecido sus servicios para ayudarnos en esta situación. ¿Qué debemos hacer?

Actualmente, estamos confiando principalmente en el boca a boca de nuestros clientes, para generar nuevos negocios. Si queremos llegar a más clientes, la publicidad puede ser una idea. ¿Debemos aumentar nuestro presupuesto en publicidad?

Ha contactado con nosotros un periodista de la famosa revista de negocios "Empresas del Universo". Para su próximo número quieren escribir un artículo sobre nosotros. Esto significaría una visita a algunas de nuestras fábricas. ¿Qué debemos hacer?

Un servicio local de notícias ha informado de fallos de calidad de nuestros {lookup.type.name@{object.products.random@{object@L2M024.ProblemStation}}} que se producen en {object.name@L2M024.ProblemStation}. ¿Qué debemos hacer?
What sort of trouble are we talking about?
That sounds rather more than a little trouble to me.\nCan you not sell off some shares or something to raise some working capital?
Sounds like you have very few options, but you obviously have some sort of plan otherwise you wouldn't have contacted me.
And I presume you want me to act as this intermediary?
So how does this work? I'm sure you understand that I need to know exactly what I'm getting myself into before I can agree to anything.
And where do I find a Corporate Accountant?
OK, I'll go and talk to them, and will let you know when I've made my decision.
Look, I'm going to have to give this some thought and get back to you.
OK, I'll see what I can do.
You'd best show me what it is.
I need to see the accounts for {param@CorpNameText} Corporation.
I've just been speaking to {param@CorpActorText} from {param@CorpNameText} Corporation, and they were hoping I may be able to help them, but suggested I talked to a Corporate Accountant first.
So is there anything that can be done?
OK, before we go any further, is there any chance of seeing what the current state of affairs is?
There's not a lot of money in the bank there.
Makes sense. So how would one go about raising the reputation?
So, basically help others to help yourself?
So the 10% the owner has at the moment isn't good at all.
How would we go about recovering the shares? Presumably there is some record of who owns them?
And then I suppose it's a case of convincing them to part with them?
Anything else I need to know?
That's making this proposal a little more tempting. As the better the Corporation does the more I benefit.

So, if for example I helped out {param@CorpActorText}, got the Corporations reputation to a respectable level, and recovered most of the shares, I would have a sizable stake in the Corporation and be in a strong position to take ownership of it?
Definitely, now you mentioned something earlier about a way to raise some working capital for the Corporation, could you tell me about that?
But without any shares available, and very few assets for collateral the Corporation owner can do very little in this case...
Thank you, for all your help.
Can I see the accounts again for {param@CorpNameText} Corporation?
Right, I've talked to the accountant and decided to help you out.
So, where do we get started?
I just hope I don't end up regretting the decision I've made...
I recently acquired at auction some old papers belonging to Molo Do. Amongst them was probably the last thing they ever wrote, your name was mentioned in it, and as suggested here I am.
Hi there, I've got a bit of a problem with an asteroid.
I need to destroy it, but it's proving rather troublesome.
Yes, nothing seems to have an effect.
Can you fit one of these proximity detonators to one of my ships?
Thanks a lot for your help, I'll be back with a ship.
You have some questions for me?
I was actually looking for it, sort of.
I recently came across some logs from a Boron called Molo Do...

found a way to locate gates not connected to the network. He discovered the gate in Heretic's End, or at least the asteroid it was inside. Unfortunately he was killed before he could prove his theory.
There's no event horizon and it doesn't lead anywhere. Otherwise it looks in excellent condition.
And where do we find one of those? As far as I know Molo Do's research died with him.
Outside the connected Universe...? Would you care to explain that one?
OK, but those gates are rather large, will we get one on a ship?
You mean like the destroyed gates in Brennan's Triumph and Belt of Aguilar?
More than likely. Any way he was the one that {3224,241066}
You mean like the destroyed gates in Heretic's End and Brennan's Triumph?
You need some resources collecting for the gate?
You'd better show me what you need.
Nothing too difficult there, I'll get on it.
Never heard of them, let alone seen any for sale.
So where am I going to find them?
And they'll sell me these crystals?
I think I get the picture, I'll see what I can do.
Void of Opportunity? Isn't that a Pirate sector?
OK, that makes sense. What do you need me to do?
I think I can manage that.
Well that was impressive, shame it's not connected to where we hoped, or anywhere in fact...
OK, I'll wait to hear from you.
Hi, you've found a solution to our problem then?
Great, if you give me their details I'll get on it.
Have you managed to fix it?
Sure, if you think it's a good idea...
I'm here about the sector I discovered.
What do I need to do?
And that's all there is to do?
I understand you have some shares in {param@CorpNameText} Corporation.
Can I see a list of what you need?
I'd need to see more details before I decide to help.
Show me what I'm dealing with.
I'll see what I can do.
I believe you have a strong box belonging to {param@RecoverActorName}.
What's it going to take to get it back?
A ship?! That's a bit steep for a few personal possessions.
I'm here to buy your {param@CorpNameText} shares.
I'd like to settle my auction bill.
You'd better show me what you need.
What do you propose we do?
How are we going to do that?
No problem, I'll be back shortly.
Hello Officer, I have some information you may find useful.
I just docked at a station when a pilot there offered me some space fuel, as far as I'm aware, apart from licensed establishments, it's illegal in {param@SectorRace} space.
Sure, there he is, he's just leaving that station.
You'll be going after him then?
Let's hope someone catches him then.
Hi there, I've been told you can help with a problem I have.
There's a certain individual we need disposed of.
How much is it going to cost me?
OK, OK, Here's your money, just make sure the job gets done.
I'm going to explore my options, I'll get back to you.
Can you show me where I'm going?
We have a deal I suppose.
Err... I'm afraid the ship got destroyed.
So I can have the shares then?
I'm not sure about fair, but I'll get your ship.
And if things don't turn around?
You wanted to see me regarding {param@CorpNameText} Corporation?
That is unfortunate, after all the hard work we put in to it.\nSo, what do you need me for?
What do you have in mind?
I'll have to think about it.
So I hear, though it would have been nice if {param@CorpOwnerName} had given me the option of buying them out after all the help I gave them to turn things round.
So what do you want from me?
I believe you have a Corporation Headquarters for me?
There are choices? What are they?
I'll take Option 1, the OTAS style.
I'll take Option 2, the NMMC style.
I'll take Option 3, the Strong Arms style.
I'm going to go and have a closer look at these stations, and see which I prefer.
I look forward to hearing from you.
What about my blueprints and wares on the station?
Thanks for the offer, but I'm happy with them where they are.
I'm going to have to think about this.
OK, I'm ready to pack up the station.
Thanks for the offer, but I'm happy with it where it is.
I need some more information about the Corporation.
What exactly do you need me to do?
I'm here about the shares... Again.
It was an accident. Honest, I warned them not to play with the switches...
So do you have another job for me?
I think so, what exactly is it you need?
Wow!! That's going to be some party.
Yes, I think I can manage that.
So where am I going for these Hacker Chips and stuff?
I've come to collect some Cartography Chips.
I don't suppose you have any Hacker Chips as well?
Hi, I'm looking to acquire some Hacker Chips, and I'm told you're the person to talk to.
Sorry, can't remember, it was in a bar on a Pirate Base, after a long night of drinking....
Were they paranoid? Not especially... Oh Paranid. Sorry, still a little fuzzy. Don't think so, only had two eyes, or were they mouths..?\nCan you help me?
Deal, just ask them to keep the noise down when they're loading.
Ah yes, they seem to have got themselves in a right old mess there.
There is usually something that can be done, it all depends how much effort you are prepared to put in, and how much of a risk you are willing to take.
That's how it stands at the moment.

True, but not a major problem, Corporate Accounts can assist with a loan to the struggling Corporation.\nI'd be more concerned by the Corporation's poor reputation, and the very low number of shares the owner has in their possession.

Basically, the better the Corporation's reputation, the more likely other companies will do business with them. Often you will find that companies will pay more for the same service from a Corporation with a decent reputation, as it gives them some assurance that their needs will be met.

Oh various ways. In the day to day running there are always decisions to be made about something or other, in some cases there could be two or more ways to achieve the same overall result. One solution to a particular problem may involve more money to set up, or have lower profit margins in the long run, but could benefit another company or the business community in general, which is good for the Corporation's reputation.

In a nutshell, yes. Though sometimes it's not always possible to choose a solution that will be best for the reputation. As you have to consider the amount of money available to set things up, and try keeping your incoming money greater than that going out... Also you may find that whilst a solution may benefit one company, it may not be so good for another, so a third solution that benefits neither could be best in the long run.

The more shares that are in a Corporation owner's possession, the more stable the Corporation is. As a general rule, the owner should hold over 50% of the shares as this gives them overall control, they also need to hold a minimum of 60% if they wish to sell the Corporation.

No, if one of the other shareholders acquired more shares than the owner, they could effectively gain control of the Corporation. There have been cases in the past where a respectable Corporation became a front for Pirates due to them having the highest shareholding.

There are usually records of the original sale, but sometimes shares will pass from one person to another for some reason. It is possible for us to trace the current owner, but may take some time in some cases.

Yes, the good news is that whilst the Corporation is in such a poor state, some shareholders will take what they can get for them, whether it's money, goods or services.\nAs the Corporation increases its reputation and value, some may not be as easily persuaded to part with them.

Only one more thing I can think of, and that is as the official insolvency agent for the Corporation, you are entitled to 30% of any shares recovered, which could give you a decent shareholding within the Corporation.

Exactly, there is also one other thing that may interest you, the previous owner before he passed away ordered and paid for a Corporation Headquarters. Licenses to own these are very rarely granted, and can only pass into possession of the Corporation owner at the time they are built. I am fairly sure the current owner is unaware of this, they have certainly never asked about it.
It's certainly something you may wish to think about.
I'd probably do the same thing. When you've made your decision, just dock at any Stock Exchange, and the Corporate Accountant there will sort things out for you.
Anything else I can help with?
No Problem, just come and talk to us again if you need further assistance.

Certainly, Corporate Accounts has the facility to lend funds in cases like this, with the current owners business record the risk was too great for us.\nHowever if someone with a good business sense, such a yourself were to step in and agree to help, then the risk goes down and we'd help financially.

We monitor the situation closely, and if we don't see an improvement we simply pull the plug, sell off the assets and leave the owner at the nearest station with the clothes on their back. To be honest though the way things are at the moment, I doubt they'd even be given the ride to a station...
Yes, we've been monitoring their situation closely, and despite you managing to recover the shares and turn round the Corporations reputation, it is still financially unstable.
Unfortunately it means we are going to have to pull the plug on it, whilst there is still a chance for us to recover the money we invested.

In order to wrap things properly up we need to have all the Corporation shares, I believe you're in possession of a number of these.\nThere is also the Corporation HQ that was ordered but never collected.
Normal practice is to sell assets at 2/3 of market value, we would also credit you with the value of the shares you own based on the price they were frozen at when trading stopped.
I'll send you details of where it can be collected from.
Let us know what you decide.
Yes, as you may know, we recently acquired this Corporation.
I can't comment on that. We just saw an opportunity and took it I'm sure you understand.
One of the assets we acquired in the takeover was a Corporation Headquarters, we have no use for it and were hoping to do some sort of deal with you in exchange for the shares you still hold.
Ah yes, I was told to expect you. The first thing you need to do is to choose the final styling for the station.
An excellent choice. I'll let you know when it's ready for collection.
No problem, just let me know when you've made a decision.

Hello {player.name},

Your Corporation Headquarters is now ready for collection.

Please dock at the {object.name@L2M024.EndShipyard} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.EndShipyard} in a TL class ship, with at least 10,500 units of cargo space free.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Hello {player.name},\n\nYour station has been loaded and is ready for you to build.

[center][yellow]Corporate Reputation[/yellow][/center]


Basically, the better the Corporation's reputation, the more likely other companies will do business with them.
Often you will find that companies will pay more for the same service from a Corporation with a decent reputation, as it gives them some assurance that their needs will be met.

There are various ways to increase the reputation. In the day to day running of the business there are always decisions to be made about something or other; in some cases there could be two or more ways to achieve the same overall result. One solution to a particular problem may involve more money to set up, or have lower profit margins in the long run, but could benefit another company or the business community in general, which is good for the Corporation's reputation.

Though sometimes it's not always possible to choose a solution that will be best for the reputation. As you have to consider the amount of money available to set things up, and try keep your incoming money greater than that going out...
Also you may find that whilst a solution may benefit one company, it may not be so good for another, so a third solution that benefits neither could be best in the long run.

[center][yellow]Share Recovery[/yellow][/center]


The more shares that are in a Corporation owner's possession, the more stable the Corporation is. As a general rule, the owner should hold over 50% of the shares as this gives them overall control, they also need to hold a minimum of 60% if they wish to sell the Corporation.

If one of the other shareholders acquired more shares than the owner, they could effectively gain control of the Corporation. There have been cases in the past where a respectable Corporation became a front for Pirates due to them having the highest shareholding and taking control.

Tracing the owners of the shares can be a little tricky, there are usually records of the original sale, but sometimes shares will pass from one person to another for some reason.
It is possible for us to trace the current owner, but may take a little time in some cases.

The good news is that whilst the Corporation is in such a poor state, some shareholders will take what they can get for them, whether it's money, goods or services.
As the Corporation increases its reputation and value, some may not be as easily persuaded to part with them.

[center][yellow]Other Information[/yellow][/center]


As the official insolvency agent for the Corporation, you are entitled to 30% of any shares recovered, which could give you a decent shareholding within the Corporation.
So the better the Corporation does, the more you'll benefit.

One other thing that may interest you, the previous owner before he passed away ordered and paid for a Corporation Headquarters.
Licenses to own these are very rarely granted, and can only pass into possession of the Corporation owner at the time they are built. I am fairly sure the current owner is unaware of this, they have certainly never asked about it.
No problem, what can I help you with?
I'll get things set up. If you need to see the Corporation information again, or want to check the current balance sheet, just dock at any Stock Exchange and talk to the Corporate Accountant.

(IM)Hello {player.name}, my name is {actor.name@L2M024.CorpOwner} and I am the owner of {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}}, a minor Corporation.
I have run into some problems with the running of my business and am looking for some assistance, your name came up as someone who has a good understanding of business, and I was hoping you could help me. I have a proposition I would like to put to you. If you're interested you can contact me at the {object.name@L2M024.ContactStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.ContactStation}.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Yes I did, if I could start by explaining my situation.

I inherited the Corporation when my uncle passed away, I thought it would be an excellent business opportunity and give me some direction in life.\nUnfortunately I didn't inherit my uncles business sense, and have got myself in a bit of trouble.
The bottom line is the business is on the verge of bankruptcy.

I was never in possession of all the shares, as my Uncle had either sold or given them away prior to his death.\nThe ones I inherited I have already sold as many as I can, being bound by law to hold ten percent of the shares.

The way things are at the moment bankruptcy is fairly certain. If I do nothing and the receivers are called in then I will lose everything. However there is a way that I can hand the running of it over to an intermediary, with the hope of turning things around so at least I have a small chance of walking away with something.
Yes, if you agree to it. You seem to have a much better head for business than me, and maybe we can restore the Corporation to what it once was.
Of course, I am a little unsure myself. You would need to speak to a Corporate Accountant, they'll be able to explain it to you, and sort out the necessary paperwork if you decide to help me.
If you dock at any Stock Exchange, you should find a Corporate Accountant that will be able to help you.
Yes, they contacted me to let me know the loan had been paid into the Corporation's account.

I've got word that Frenk Stringer has got some problems, and, as it happens he has a number of the Corporations shares. Maybe if you could help him, he might be willing to exchange his shares in return for your assistance.
Once again I must thank for your assistance.

Hello {player.name},

I am led to believe that you recently discovered a new sector.

There is a service I can provide to move your Headquarters to a new location. You will find me on {object.name@L2M024.PlayerHQ} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.PlayerHQ} if you're interested.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
I'm offering you the chance to pack this station back into a TL so you can relocate it if you wish.
I'm offering you the chance to pack this station and your Corporation HQ back into a TL so you can relocate them if you wish.

They'll be moved with the station, you don't need to worry about that.\nYou should however make sure any reverse engineering, ship building, repairs or scrapping are completed before we start. Oh and undock any ships, the repacking tends to make a mess of them.
So what do you want to do?
When you're ready, just park a TL in this sector and give me a shout. I'll take it from there.
I'll head over to your Corporation HQ. When you're ready, just park a TL within 10km of the station and give me a shout. I'll take it from there.
OK, stand back and let me get to work.
I couldn't find a suitable ship in the sector to pack the station in.
Your TL doesn't have enough space to get the station in, you need at least {value@L2M024.HQSpaceNeeded} units of free space.
You still have ships docked at the station. Please move them to a safe distance.
That was close, I realised at the last moment there was some money on the station, I have transferred {value.formatted@L2M024.StationCredits} to your account for safe keeping.
Well I think I'm done here, see you around.
OK, that's the first one packed, I'm heading over to your {object.name@L2M024.PlayerHQCorp} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.PlayerHQCorp}. Contact me there when you're ready to pack that one up.
Ah yes, poor old Molo Do, always chasing some rumour. I told him that it would get him killed one day.
Yes, I'll have it uploaded to your ship's computer. If you choose to continue their work, make sure you don't share their fate.
What sort of a problem are we talking about?
I assume you've tried the usual methods, mobile drilling lasers, missiles etc...

There is one method we have used in cases such as this quite effectively. We use an old freighter, fit it with a remote detonator, pack it with explosives, park it close to the asteroid and blow it up.
Sure, you dock a freighter here, and pay the 75,000 Credits it costs to have it fitted and we'll sort it for you.

All sorted, you will need to put some mines in the cargo bay as explosives. We always use a minimum of twenty, just to be sure. When it's ready, park it as close to the asteroid as you can, but no more than 5km away, then get yourself to a safe distance.
Just need to take your payment, and I'll turn control of the ship back over to you.

Hello {player.name}, I work for the Gate Research Department based at the {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.ResearchStation}. My sensors have just picked up a huge spike in the type of energy associated with the gates, this leads me to believe that there may be more gates there now than there were earlier in Heretic's End, where the event was recorded.

The data collected also puts your ship as the closest thing to the source of the energy spike. I shall probably need you to answer some questions, and will be in touch.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

Hello Pilot, I recently contacted you regarding the energy spikes we detected in Heretic's End. I have confirmed that there is indeed one more gate there than there should be.
There are questions that need to be answered regarding this, and I'm hoping you may be able to help. Please contact me at {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} at your earliest conveniance.

{actor.name@L2M024.GateActor}.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Yes, you were the closest person to the new gate when it appeared in Heretic's End, how come you were there?
So how did you know where to look?
Most unfortunate indeed.\nInside an asteroid you say? Remarkable, but it is a fully working gate?
What we need is another gate to try and connect it to.

Yes, unfortunately those gates, and other similar ones in the connected Universe have long been picked over for anything useful, and are totally beyond repair, we've already considered that idea.\nNo, we're going to have to look outside the connected Universe!
I believe you're in possession of an Unfocused Jump Drive? From what I gather, this takes you to sectors 'off the grid' so to speak, which should give us the best chance to find a repairable gate.

It will have to be a TL class ship, but I believe I can get hold of some new compression technology being developed here, that will help, even then it will probably take up 25,000 units of cargo space.\nPick me up in TL class ship, and we'll give it a try. This is one trip I don't want to miss out on.
Molo Do? He worked here for a while, bit of an eccentric, had some fairly wild ideas about the gates if I recall.
The Terrans managed to build a working gate some time ago, but with the war going on I don't think they will be willing to help us. We may have to look at trying to repair a broken gate.
Molo Do? That wouldn't be the Boron our patrols caught nosing around the gate we built, and chased out of our sectors would it?

We managed to build a working gate some time ago, but with most of available resources being diverted to the war effort, building another is out of the question. We may have to look at trying to repair a broken gate.
We're going to have to make some space if we have a hope of getting the gate on board, we need to at least 25,000 units of cargo space to fit it in.
Great work pilot, I'll get to work and see if this gate is salvageable. I'll be in touch when I know more.

Hello {player.name}, I've had a good look at the gate we recovered, and believe we will be able to repair it. There are a few things I'm going to need, if you could stop by the {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} I'll let you know what we need.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
That's all I can think of for the moment.
Not quite, there is something else, but I fear this will be a little more difficult.
I'm not surprised, they aren't widely used anymore.
The only ones I've heard of recently are being hauled by Pirates posing as Salvage Crews, running from Maelstrom down to Gain Star.
Doubtful, I fear you may have to resort to other methods to acquire them...
Excellent work Pilot. These are just what I need; it shouldn't take too much longer now. I'll let you know when it's ready.

Hello {player.name}, I have managed to fix the gate, and were ready to deploy it. Come by the {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} and I'll fill you in on the plan.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

This is just amazing, a previously undiscovered sector, not what I was expecting at all.
I need to get back to the {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} and let my colleagues know what we've found.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Thank you Pilot, there are very few people that are lucky enough to be present when a new sector is discovered. Also the data I managed to collect will aid us in further research of the gates.
Yes, we've got it loaded on a Science Ship ready to go.
We're going to put it in Void of Opportunity...

It is, but our calculations put the best chance of it connecting to the gate in Heretic's End is from the North of Void of Opportunity.\nAlso, if successful, the Pirates will act as a buffer zone between the Terrans and the Commonwealth, and give the Argons a staging post to push into Heretic's End on two fronts.

It is, but our calculations put the best chance of it connecting to the gate in Heretic's End is from the North of Void of Opportunity.\nAlso, if successful, it will give us a back door into the Commonwealth, which will be useful with the war going on.

We have already sent in a scout, who dropped a beacon for us at what we think will be the best location for the gate.\nThey did however report moderate Pirate activity in the sector, and we're anticipating they won't be happy with what we're doing there. We need you to provide protection for the Science Ship until the gate is deployed.
There is one possibility, and that's to use the Gate Hub to force a connection, the hub gate's pair will need to connect to a gate as well so hopefully will pick up the other unconnected gate.
Possibly... it can't hurt to try. I'd need to check some figures first.\nAnyway, I'm heading back to base as I've got to get this ship back, I'll let you know when I've found a solution.
I think so, though we're going to need some Cartography and Hacker Chips for it to have any chance of success.
I have some contacts that should be able to help us.
If I could trouble you for a ride over to the hub first, I'll start getting things set up over there, and will upload the contact details for the Cartography Chips on route.
I think so.... Oh, hang on a minute... that's interesting...

Small power surge, nothing to worry about... I hope.\nSorry... What? Interesting? Oh yes, ah, it appears the hub was getting conflicting gate signals. That should do it...\nWhich set of gates do you want to use?
That's it... sort of... The gates seem to be working now, but not quite as we expected. Pick me up and we'll go take a look.

{player.name},

I understand you recently discovered an area of uncharted space, which is now showing as having been connected to the gate network.

You are required to register this area with Stellar Cartography. Please come to {object.name@L2M024.NMMCHQ} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.NMMCHQ} at your earliest convenience.


{actor.name@L2M024.Sector Registrar}.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Ahh yesss, very exciting, a new sector.
Very easy, all you need to do is name it.
That's all, as I said very easy.
And if I do, what's it to you?
Are you now? I'm not in a desperate need for money right now, but I'll make a deal with you.

I've run into a spot of trouble, now I've swapped my old ship for a second hand fighter which will help me with my problem. Thing is it needs some equipment before it will be of any use, if I leave the station in it as it is I'll be a sitting duck.\nYou bring me the equipment, and the shares are yours, I'll even pay for the equipment.
So, have we got a deal?

Great Work Pilot, with this equipment I should be able to make my problem go away.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR1ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, plus [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.WareValue}[/yellow] Credits to cover the cost of the equipment.

Hello {player.name}, we have traced another of {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}}'s shareholders to the {object.name@L2M024.RecoverStation{value@L2M024.RecoverNo}} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.RecoverStation{value@L2M024.RecoverNo}}.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Yes, and a poor investment they turned out to be.
Possibly, however I have a more pressing issue to deal with at the moment.
I've just got word that one of my stations is about to come under attack.\nI'll tell you what, you help protect my station, then the shares are yours.
Yes the station has been destroyed.
Yes, indeed, however if you still want the shares, I have discovered who was behind the attack.\nMake sure they're disposed of and the shares are yours.
Thank you, the station is now safe.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR2ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
Well done! {actor.name@L2M024 Shares2 Offer.1 L0Mark} has now paid for their crimes.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR2ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.

Alas no more, I foolishly used my strong box containing the shares as collateral in a game of cards recently. I'd dearly like to get it back as it contains other items of sentimental value.\nThe person who has it won't speak to me, but maybe you could try and get it back in exchange for the shares?
Indeed I do. Poor card player that one, very fortunate for me.
Maybe we could trade? You bring me something and we deal.
You bring me this, I give you the strong box.
It's my final offer, take it or leave it.
I have received the ship, thank you. If you dock here I will hand over the strong box.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Thank you for recovering my strong box.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR3ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
Possibly, or possibly you could help me with a problem.

Several of my trade convoys have been attacked by the Yaki, nothing major, but enough to disrupt my business.\nI have two convoys due to depart from different stations, but currently have no escorts available for them.\nIf you could get them safely to their destinations you can have the shares.

Excellent work pilot, all {value@L2M024 Shares4 Offer.1 L0M83 Convoy Total} Ships made it safely to their destinations.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR4ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.

You managed to get {value@L2M024 Shares4 Offer.1 L0M83 DockedCount} out of a total of {value@L2M024 Shares4 Offer.1 L0M83 Convoy Total} Ships safely to their destination.

I'll give you [green]{value@L2M024.SR4ShareReward}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares for those that arrived safely. The rest you'll have to buy off me for [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR4SharePayAmount}[/yellow] Credits.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

Both convoys have been destroyed!! Call yourself a combat pilot? Get out of here, this mission is over. You'll have to buy the shares off me for [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR4SharePayAmount}[/yellow] Credits.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

What are you playing at Pilot?! I have enough trouble with the Yaki attacking my convoys without you helping them out. This job is cancelled.

The shares you'll have to buy, and the price just doubled to [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR4SharePayAmount}[/yellow] Credits.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

Going get a little tough did it? Well thanks for nothing.

You'll have to buy the shares off me for [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR4SharePayAmount}[/yellow] Credits.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Thank you, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR4SharesBought}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
You know what my price is.
I've been let down by one of my suppliers, and as a result some of my factories are running short of resources. You get me the resources I need, and the shares are yours.

Great work Pilot, this should keep my factories running for a while.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR5ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, plus [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR5WareValue}[/yellow] Credits to cover the cost of the wares.

Hello {player.name}.

We've just got word that one of {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}}'s shareholders, a Boron by the name of Molo Do, was recently killed.
Their personal effects have been put up for auction at the {object.name@L2M024.RecoverStation{value@L2M024.RecoverNo}} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.RecoverStation{value@L2M024.RecoverNo}}.

You'd better hurry over there, {value@L2M024.SR6ShareAmount} shares are in Lot 42, listed as assorted papers.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
You're a bit late, the auction's almost over.
That's starting now, looks like you were just in time.
Here you go. Lot 42, assorted papers of one Molo Do including [green]{value@L2M024.SR6ShareAmount}[/green] shares in {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}}.
You have insufficient funds in your bank at present to pay for the shares. Please come back when you are able to pay.
Your bank has declined the transfer of money for Lot 42. Please return when you have sufficient funds to cover the cost.
I have decided to go into the Crystals business, and am looking for someone to build me a station and supply it with enough resources to get it running. You do this for me and the shares are yours.

Excellent work Pilot, the station is up and running.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR7ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, plus [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR7WareValue}[/yellow] Credits to cover the cost of the station and resources.
Pilot, it's crucial that you have 25 units of space fuel for the plan to work. Get some more immediately.

OK Pilot, we're on board.
Our latest intelligence puts {actor.name@L2M024.Rival} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.SR8 TargetShip}, so that would be a good place to start.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Pilot, we all need to be on the same ship if we're going to complete this mission.
I think we must have spooked him and he's jumped away. Let's search the nearby sectors, I don't think he'll have gone far.
We've lost him, probably trying to lose us when he thought we weren't looking. Let's search the nearby sectors, I don't think he'll have gone far.
OK, we've managed to plant the space fuel on {actor.name@L2M024.Rival}'s ship, let's go and tip off the police.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

Great, it looks like {actor.name@L2M024.Rival}'s been arrested, let's get back to {object.name@L2M024.RecoverStation8} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.RecoverStation8}.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
{actor.name@L2M024.Rival}'s flying off, something has gone wrong, we'd better find out what.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
{actor.name@L2M024.Rival}'s jumped away, something has gone wrong, we'd better find out what.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

That's not good, we're going to have to dispose of him now. You can take care of it yourself, but there may be repercussions.
If you've got some spare Credits, then {actor.name@L2M024.Pirate} on the {object.name@L2M024.SR8 PirateBase} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.SR8 PirateBase} can usually be relied on to provide some assistance to get the job done.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
You don't have the Credits to buy our services. Come back when you have enough money.
Thank you for your business. {actor.name@L2M024.Rival} will soon be taken care of.
That's them dealt with, looks like our work here is done. Let's get back to {object.name@L2M024.RecoverStation8} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.RecoverStation8}.
We have recently had a number of customers cancel their parcel delivery contracts with us. Our investigations have discovered that a smaller independent supplier has started to undercut our prices.
The easiest solution would be simply to 'dispose' of them, but that may lead to some awkward questions.\nWe have decided the best course of action is to discredit them.

I have a couple of mercenaries on the way to assist you, what I need you to do is acquire 25 units of space fuel, which we'll plant on the rivals ship, then tip off the local police.\nOnce you have the space fuel come back here to pick up the mercenaries.
It certainly is, can you point him out to us?
They explained that someone must have planted the space fuel in their ship, and gave us a donation for the Argon Police Christmas fund, so we let them off with a warning.
They've made a run for it.
We'll post a bulletin about him being wanted, but he's out of our jurisdiction now.
That won't be a problem, as long as you have the Credits.

It is, but the 'accident' will be in no way traceable back to you.\nYou could try one of the cheaper individuals who offer the same service, but don't blame me if the police trace the hit back to you...

Well done Pilot, news of {actor.name@L2M024.Rival}'s arrest should soon be reaching his customers.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR8ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.

Getting away with bribing a Police Officer would suggest that they have some influential friends.
At least they won't be interfering with our business again.

As promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR8ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.

Resisting arrest, never a good idea with those trigger happy {lookup.race.name@{value@L2M024.SR8 TargetRace}} Police.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR8ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
So they tried to make a run for it, didn't get very far from what I hear.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR8ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
I did, however they were on one of my ships when I was moving to a new sector.

The pilot thought they could save some time and tried taking a shortcut across a Xenon sector. The last message we got was that they were abandoning ship.\nThe ship is still there, the pilot we have had no news of yet.\nIf you were to return the ship to me, I'd gladly exchange the shares for it.
So what do you say, do we have a deal?

Yes, so I gather. I however have some better news; the pilot was rescued by a military convoy passing through the sector. They managed to get some of my documents off the ship when they abandoned it, amongst them the shares you were after.
Have them? I believe we had a deal, you return my ship and I give you the shares. I am still a ship down, you replace it and you can have the shares.
I think that's a fair offer, don't you?
Thank you for recovering my ship.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR9ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
Thank you for the ship.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR9ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
Select the ship you wish to turn over.\n\n[center][select value='TurnOverShip'] {object.name@L2M024.SR9AbandonedShip} [/select][/center]

Hello {player.name},

I need to speak to you with regards to the {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Corporation.

Please contact me at the {object.name@L2M024.EndStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.EndStation}.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

Hello {player.name},

I thought I ought you let you know I have sold {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}}.

With the reputation restored, business going well and the majority of shares back in my possession I was approached by Scionfire who made me an offer for the Corporation.

Well the money was on the table and I got out whilst I could.

Could you please contact {actor.name@L2M024.EndGameActor} at the {object.name@L2M024.EndStation} in {object.sector.name@L2M024.EndStation}, as there are a few loose ends they need to tie up with you.


[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
You're going to need 25 units of Space Fuel before we can start this mission.
You're going to need to clear some cargo space if we're both going to get on board.
Your ship's cargo class is insufficient for this mission.
We'd appreciate being able to breathe whilst on board, you're going to have to get cargo lifesupport or a passenger transport, if we're going to start this mission.
I've been let down by one of my pilots, and I have a tour due to depart. If you help me out, you can have the shares.

Excellent work Pilot, the tour group seem extremely happy with the trip you took them on.\n\nHere are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR5ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, plus [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024 Shares5 Offer.RewardCr}[/yellow] Credits as promised.
If you still want the shares come and see me, I have another little job you could do for me, one that doesn't involve lifeforms...

Well at least you managed to accomplish that task adequately...
I would invite you to the party, but I'd fear for my guests safety.

I suppose you've earned these, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR5ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, plus [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR5WareValue}[/yellow] Credits to cover the cost of the wares.
You're lucky I don't subject you to the same fate as those passengers...
I'm sure you do, however I am looking for some supplies to loosen people up, get them in the mood, if you catch my drift...
It certainly will, but can you get the goods?

[center][red]Deed of Sector Ownership[/red][/center]

Standard Galactic Co-ordinates: [yellow]X = 12, Y = 4[/yellow]

Sector Name: [yellow]{sector.name@L2M024.PlayerSector}[/yellow]

Registered Owner: [yellow]{player.name}[/yellow]

Date: [yellow]768-05-{value@L2M024.Playdays}[/yellow]


Signed: [i]Kokalis Tumulis Gustiosanis IX[/i], Sector Registrar.
On behalf of Stellar Cartography, PTNI Headquarters.
I don't understand, I was convinced it would work.
Hello {player.name}, I think I know how to get it to work. Come by the {object.name@L2M024.ResearchStation} and I'll fill you in on the details.

You need to talk to Uckmanckamstras, he definitely has the Cartography Chips we need, all you have to do is collect them.\nThere's a good chance he'll have got his hands on some Hacker Chips as well by the time you get there, if not he'll know who you can get them off of.\nI'll upload the details of where to find him to your ship's computer.

Unfortunately not, the only person I could find with any available is Jennaia Sahkarna, and she won't deal with me due to a minor disagreement.\nI'll give you her details, just don't tell her I sent you.\nIn the meantime if you dock I'll load up your Cartography Chips.
You're going to have to free up some cargo space, 20 units should be enough to do it.
Doubtful. But I can sell you 20 Hacker Chips for 150,000 Credits.
Hello {player.name}, we've finished equipping your ship and it's ready for collection.\n\n[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]
Excellent, it shouldn't take much longer to get things working here. I'll let you know when I'm ready to give it a try.
OK, I think we're ready to attempt the forced connection.
Unfortunately the ship got destroyed before reaching it's destination, can you modify another for me?
Certainly, just deliver another ship and we'll sort it. I'll have to charge you again for our services, I'm sure you understand.
Of course, I'll sort a ship out for you.
OK, let's try again. We're going to have to get a TL class ship to complete the mission.

The station has been destroyed!!
Preliminary data from the scene indicates that you were responsible.

In light of this I have a new deal for the shares.
First I need to replace my {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.S2DefendStationType}} at a cost of [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.S2StationCost}[/yellow] Credits.
Next there are set up costs of [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.S2StationSetUp}[/yellow] Credits to get the station running again.
Finally there are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR2ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares, currently valued at [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR2ShareValue}[/yellow] Credits.

You pay me a total of [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M024.SR2ReplaceTotal}[/yellow] Credits and the shares are yours.

[center][select value='Accept'] OK [/select][/center]

A payment of {value.formatted@L2M024.SR2ReplaceTotal} Credits needs to be paid to replace the {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.S2DefendStationType}} at a cost of {value.formatted@L2M024.S2StationCost} Credits, set up costs of {value.formatted@L2M024.S2StationSetUp} Credits, and {value.formatted@L2M024.SR2ShareValue} Credits for the shares.
I'm here to pay for the {lookup.type.name@{value@L2M024.S2DefendStationType}} I destroyed.
Purchase and set up of station, plus cost of shares.
Thank you for taking responsibility for your actions.\n\nAs promised, here are the [green]{value@L2M024.SR2ShareAmount}[/green] {3224,{value@L2M024.CorpNameID}} Shares.
We'll get to work on this right away. I'll be in touch when it's ready.

page.title: Common Mission Lines
page.t: Completar esta mision será un golpe muy duro para nuestros enemigos.
Esta tarea es de la máxima importancia para la guerra.
Completar este cometido ayudara en la guerra de manera inmensurable.
Te hemos dado una nave {object.class.name@RewardedShip} clase {object.type.name@RewardedShip}.

page.title: L2 Generic Assassination
page.t: Un piloto {lookup.race.name@{param@EnemyRace}} excepcional nos ha estado causando todo tipo de problemas; interrumpiendo lineas de suministro y saqueando cargueros. Esto debe parar, por todos los medios necesarios.

page.title: L2 Transport Cargo
page.t: Como líder de escuadrón de algunas reservas militares, me toca a mi mantener a los muchachos organizados, listos para partir con la mente clara. Desafortunadamente, creo que les he presionado demasiado y me gustaría compensarles haciéndoles trabajar en algo. Necesito a alguien que consiga algunas botellas de {lookup.typename.name@SS_WARE_DUMMY32}. Esa si que es buena!

Mi nombre es {actor.name@L2M116 Offer.1 Guide} y tengo una orden de solicitud de alimentos. Nuestras tropas y pilotos no están disfrutando del frio del Sistema Solar y la moral esta bajando. Si pudiéramos conseguir algo de {lookup.typename.name@SS_WARE_LFOODSTUFF} les haríamos mucho bien!

page.title: L2 Build Stations
page.t: Nuestra nueva estación esta en el lugar correcto, nos gustaría tenerla a pleno rendimiento lo antes posible. Para conseguirlo, estamos buscando a alguien que nos pueda suministrar los recursos necesarios para iniciar la producción.

Para obtener los máximos beneficios necesitamos que la estación entre en funcionamiento lo más rápido posible. Necesitamos a alguien que nos suministre los recursos necesarios para avanzar en la puesta en marcha.
Excelente! Estamos transfiriendo sus {value@L2M122 Offer A.RewardCr} créditos ahora.

Si te interesa tengo otro trabajo para ti. Puedes contactar conmigo en {object.name@L2M122.station} en {object.sector.name@L2M122.station}.

{object.name@L2M122 Offer.1 L0M22 BuiltStation}

page.title: L2 Deploy Object
page.descr: Texts for deploy object generic mission
page.t: Seras reembolsado del coste ( del objeto depositado).
(Fin)Estamos transfiriendo los {value@L2M142.Reward} créditos que has ganado.
(Exito parcial)Bien, supongo que asi tendra que ser. {3342,2}

Se te ha acabado el tiempo y no has depositado nada. Espero que entiendas que desastroso es esto! Solo Espero que el enemigo no ataque este sector antes de que consigamos que alguien competente haga el trabajo.

page.title: L2 Multiple Transport
page.t: Se necesita transporte multiple de pasajeros
Se requiere servicio de lanzadera local
Se necesita piloto de taxi multi-descarga

Me he liado un poco con el horario de las lanzaderas y voy a necesitar algo de ayuda para corregirlo. \nLos pasajeros junto con su punto de recogida y sectores de destino se enumeran a continuación.\nNecesito a alguien con una nave de transporte de pasajeros, y le estaría muy agradecido si me pudiera ayudar.

¡Se suponía que tenias que haber recogido y entregado ya a todos los pasajeros! Esta misión queda cancelada, solo deja a los pasajeros que te hayas dignado a recoger en la siguiente estación en la que atraques y ya encontrare a alguien de más confianza para hacer el trabajo.\n\nAun así te pagare [green]{value.formatted@L2M181.PartialPay}[/green] créditos por los [yellow]{value@L2M181 Offer.1 Passengers Delivered}[/yellow] pasajeros que has conseguido entregar.

¡Parece que mi destinación ha sido destruida! ¿Podría llevarme a [red]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint {counter@DCount}}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint {counter@DCount}}[/red] en su lugar por favor.

La estación a la que viajaba {actor.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} Passenger {counter@DCount}} ha sido destruida! Su destino ha cambiado a [red]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint {counter@DCount}}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint {counter@DCount}}.[/red]
Las Autoridades están investigando la repentina salida de {actor.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} Passenger {counter@CCount}}.
Una de las estaciones en las que debías recoger pasajeros ha sido destruida en {sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} MissionSector {counter@CCount}}, por lo que allí ya no hay pasajeros que recoger...
Esta misión se ha cancelado. Si sigue teniendo a bordo de alguna de sus naves algún pasajero, por favor déjelos en una estación dónde podamos ordenar que un piloto de confianza los recoja.
Buen trabajo piloto, parece que ha logrado entregar todos los pasajeros a salvo. Estamos transfiriendo su pago ahora.

¡Y tú te haces llanar profesional!! Matar a tus pasajeros o venderlos como esclavos no ha sido una buena idea. Esta misión se ha cancelado, y le agradecería que dejara los pasajeros restantes en una estación... Preferiblemente vivos.

¡A que está jugando piloto! Se que a veces hay pasajeros que son un poco molestos, pero empujarlos por la esclusa no es la solución... Esta misión queda cancelada. Si todavía tiene algún pasajero a bordo dejelo en alguna estación y así le ahorrará la humillación de una caminata espacial...
Gracias {player.name} por aceptar ayudarme en esta tarea. Estos son algunos detalles más completos de los pasajeros, y desde, y hacia donde necesitan transporte.

{3381,181200}\n\n[yellow]{actor.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} Passenger 1}[/yellow] necesita ser recogido en [green]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 1}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 1}[/green] y llevado a [red]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 1}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 1}.[/red]

{3381,181201}\n\n[yellow]{actor.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} Passenger 2}[/yellow] necesita ser recogido en [green]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 2}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 2}[/green] y llevado a [red]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 2}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 2}.[/red]

{3381,181202}\n\n[yellow]{actor.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} Passenger 3}[/yellow] necesita ser recogido en [green]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 3}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} CollectPoint 3}[/green] y llevado a [red]{object.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 3}, {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} DeliverPoint 3}.[/red]

page.title: L2 Tour Of A Lifetime
page.t: (Blank, used to create dummy objective entry)
El Viaje de tu Vida Extremo

Tengo un grupo de {value@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} PassengerTotal} pasajeros con reserva en 'El Viaje de tu Vida', por desgracia nuestro piloto habitual no puede hacerlo, así que estoy buscando a alguien con una nave de Transporte de Pasajeros que me pueda ayudar. El trabajo incluye visitar los sectores principales de {value@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} StationCount} , en los que se requiere que atraque en una estación para que el grupo pueda echar un vistazo alrededor - solo asegurese que estan todos a bordo antes de volver a partir.\nSe le pagará un bonus extra por cada sector adicional que visiten durante el viaje.

Tengo un grupo de {value@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} PassengerTotal} pasajeros con reserva en 'El Viaje de tu Vida Extremo', pero por alguna razón desconocida nuestro piloto habitual no está disponible. Estoy buscandoa a alguien con una nave de Transporte de Pasajeros que me pueda ayudar. El trabajo incluye visitar los once sectores Xenon.
a un mínimo de {value@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} StationCount} sectores.
\053 {value.formatted@L2M182 Offer.BonusCr} Créditos extra por cada sector adicional visitado.

Se suponía que ya deberías haber acabado el viaje! Esta misión queda cancelada, solo deja a cualquier miembro del grupo del viaje en la próxima estación en que atraques y buscaré a alguien confianza para hacer el trabajo..
Atención:\nMiembros del grupo del Viaje permanecen en la estación.
Todos los miembros del grupo de Viaje estan a bordo.
Buen trabajo piloto, parece que habeis logrado acabar el recorrido con seguridad. Tu pago de {value.formatted@L2M182.TotalPay} se está transferiendo ahora.

Buen trabajo piloto, parece que habeis logrado acabar el recorrido con seguridad..\nTus datos de vuelo indican que solo habeis visitado un sector extra adicional en el Viaje. Un bonus de {value.formatted@L2M182.BonusPay} ha sido añadido según lo acordado {value.formatted@L2M182 Offer.RewardCr}, ascendiendo el pago total a {value.formatted@L2M182.TotalPay} créditos, que se están transfiriendo ahora.

Excelebte trabajo piloto, parece que el grupo ha tenido un Viaje memorable.\nTus datos de vuelo indican que los llevó a {value@L2M182 Offer.1 L0M82 Bonus Sectors} sectores adicionales en el recorrido. Un bonus de {value.formatted@L2M182.BonusPay} creditos han sido añadidos a los {value.formatted@L2M182 Offer.RewardCr} acordados, ascendiendo el pago total a {value.formatted@L2M182.TotalPay} Créditos, que se están transfiriendo ahora.
Esta misión se ha cancelado. Si sigue teniendo a bordo de alguna de sus naves algún pasajero, por favor déjelos en una estación dónde podamos ordenar que un piloto de confianza los recoja.
Buen trabajo piloto, parece que ha logrado volver con los pasajeros a salvo. Estamos transfiriendo su pago ahora.

¡Y tú te haces llanar profesional!! Matar a tus pasajeros o venderlos como esclavos no ha sido una buena idea. Esta misión se ha cancelado, y le agradecería que dejara los pasajeros restantes en una estación... Preferiblemente vivos.

¡A que está jugando piloto! Se que a veces hay pasajeros que son un poco molestos, pero empujarlos por la esclusa no es la solución... Esta misión se ha cancelado. Si todavía tiene algún pasajero a bordo dejelo en alguna estación y así le ahorrará la humillación de una caminata espacial...
Vas a tener que hacer un poco de espacio para que todo el Grupo de Viaje pueda volver a bordo. Necesitas como mínimo {value@L0M82.SpaceNeeded} unidades de espacio libre para acomodarlos a todos.
Vas a tener que hacer un poco de espacio para que todos podamos volver a bordo. Si puedes liberar {value@L0M82.MoreSpaceNeeded} unidades, creo que deberiamos caber todos.
Sector no incluido en el Tour.

page.title: L2 Dual Convoy
page.t: Recientemente he perdido varios convoyes por los ataques de {lookup.race.name@{param@EnemyRace}}. Tengo dos convoyes listos para salir.\n Y necesito a alguien que de protección a los dos convoyes.
Convoy en ruta desde {object.sector.name@{param@StartStation1}} a {object.name@{param@EndStation1}} en {object.sector.name@{param@EndStation1}}
Convoy en ruta desde {object.sector.name@{param@StartStation2}} a {object.name@{param@EndStation2}} en {object.sector.name@{param@EndStation2}}
{lookup.race.name@{value@L0M83.EnemyRace}} descubierto en dirección a {object.sector.name@{param@Cue}.{param@ID} L0M83 Convoy {value@L0M83 Enemies.AttackNo} Leader}.

Dos Convoyes, {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 Convoy Total} naves, y tu solo has conseguido que llegue una a su destino. Tengo razónes para no pagarte nada, pero supongo que te debo algo, aquí tienes [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos por el unico que has conseguido mantener a salvo.

Excelente trabajo piloto, todas las {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 Convoy Total} naves han llegado a su destino de una pieza. Lo prometido es deuda, transfiriendo [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos a tu cuenta.

La mitad de las naves han llegado a su destino. Si hacemos un pequeño cálculo, la mitad de las naves es la mitad del trabajo, por lo tanto te pago la mitad de lo acordado, transfiriendo [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos a tu cuenta ahora.

Más de la mitad de naves llegaron a su destino, supongo que era de esperar perder alguna nave. Aquí estan [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos por {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 DockedCount} naves conducidas con éxito a su destino.

Menos de la mitad de naves llegaron a su destino! Pensé que dijiste que podías hacer el trabajo. Aquí estan [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos por {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 DockedCount} naves conducidas con éxito a su destino.

Se las arregló para que {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 DockedCount} del total de {value@L2M183 Offer.1 L0M83 Convoy Total} naves llegaran a su destino. Pagare solo por aquellas que llegaron a su destino, aquí estan [yellow]{value.formatted@L2M183.FinalReward}[/yellow] créditos.
Ambos convoyes han sido destruidos! ¿Y te haces llamar piloto de combate? Fuera de aquí, esta misión ha terminado
!A que estas jugando piloto!! Ya tengo bastantes problemas con los {lookup.race.name@{value@L2M183.EnemyRace}} atacando mis convoyes sin que tú hagas nada al respecto. Este trabajo se ha cancelado.
¿Las cosas se pusieron difíciles? Bueno, gracias por nada.

page.title: Generic player replies
page.t: Necesito a alguien para reparar una estación.
¿Puedes ayudarme con la reparación de la estación?
Vas a tener que darte prisa, el tour esta esperando para salir.
